standards.benchmark: Use timelines to establish cause and effect relationships of historical events.
Interpret and evaluate primary and secondary sources.
Locate the extent of Byzantine territory at the height of the empire.
Analyze the extent to which the Byzantine Empire was a continuation of the old Roman Empire.
Explain the contributions of the Byzantine Empire.
Describe the causes and effects of the Crusades on Western Europe and the Middle East.
Describe the development of feudalism and manorialism and their impact on medieval Europe.
Discuss significant people and beliefs associated with Islam.
Describe the interaction among Muslim, Christian, and Jewish societies in Medieval Spain.
Identify the economic and political causes for the rise of the Italian city-states during the Renaissance.
Identify the major artistic, literary, and technological contributions of individuals during the Renaissance.
Describe the causes and effects of the Protestant Reformation.
Analyze the Roman Catholic Church's response to the Protestant Reformation.
Summarize the causes that led to the Age of Exploration.
Examine the various economic and political systems of Portugal, Spain, the Netherlands, France, and England in the Americas.
Compare the causes and effects of the development of constitutional monarchy in England with those of the development of absolute monarchy in France, Spain, and Russia.
Evaluate the impact of Enlightenment ideals on the development of economic, political, and religious structures in Western civilization.
Describe the causes and effects of the Scientific Revolution.
Compare the causes and effects of the French Revolution.
Analyze the causes and effects of the Industrial Revolution.
